title: 109_s913
content: The Act titled "Southwest Bridge Research Center Establishment Act of 2005" establishes a Bridge Research Center. The Southwest Bridge Research Center, established by the Southwest Bridge Research Center Establishment Act of 2005, aims to improve bridge performance nationally by increasing skilled individuals in transportation. The Southwest Bridge Research Center, established in 2005, focuses on improving bridge performance by training individuals in transportation, monitoring structural health, developing innovative technologies for testing and assessment, ensuring bridge safety and security, and providing education in bridge inspection and evaluation. The Center conducts basic and applied research to advance transportation knowledge and offers multidisciplinary education programs. The institution must maintain a program of technology transfer for research results and commit to funding transportation research activities. Federal funding requires cost sharing with the institution. The Federal share of any activity funded under this subsection is 50%, while the non-Federal share may include funds from specified sections of title 23. The institution must allocate at least $200,000 annually to support ongoing transportation research and education programs. Program coordination is also emphasized. The Secretary coordinates research, education, training, and technology transfer activities of the Center, disseminates research results, and operates a clearinghouse for information. Annual review and evaluation of programs funded by grants are conducted in accordance with a developed plan. The Secretary provides a $3,000,000 grant annually from 2005 to 2010 for the Center to carry out activities funded under this subsection. The funds remain available for 2 years after the fiscal year they are authorized. Authorization of appropriations is set at $3,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2005 to 2010.
